```json
{
    "Name": "Counting Process",
    "Definition": "A stochastic process representing the total number of events that have occurred up to a given time",
    "Formal Language": "N(t) : t \ge 0"
}
```

```json
{
    "Name": "Absolute Deviation",
    "Definition": "The absolute difference between each data point and the mean or median of a data set",
    "Formal Language": "Absolute Deviation = |x - μ| or |x - M|, where x is a data point, μ is the mean, and M is the median"
}
```

```json
{
    "Name": "Mean Deviation",
    "Definition": "The average of the absolute differences between each data point and the mean of the data set.",
    "Formal Language": "Mean Deviation = (1/n) * Σ|xi - μ|"
}
```

```json
{
    "Name": "Standard Error",
    "Definition": "A measure of the statistical accuracy of an estimate, indicating the standard deviation of the sampling distribution of a statistic.",
    "Formal Language": "Standard Error \in Statistics"
}
```

```json
{
    "Name": "Population Variance",
    "Definition": "A measure of the dispersion of a set of data points in a population, calculated as the average of the squared differences from the mean.",
    "Formal Language": "Population Variance \sigma^2 = \frac{1}{N}\sum_{i=1}^{N}(x_i - \mu)^2"
}
```

```json
{
    "Name": "Ogive",
    "Definition": "A graph that represents the cumulative frequency or cumulative relative frequency for the class intervals of a dataset",
    "Formal Language": "Ogive ∈ Graph"
}
```

```json
{
    "Name": "Random",
    "Definition": "Pertaining to a process or sequence in which each outcome is equally likely and follows no predictable pattern.",
    "Formal Language": "Random \in Probability Theory"
}
```

```json
{
    "Name": "Random Distribution",
    "Definition": "A random distribution is a statistical function that defines the likelihood of obtaining the possible values that a random variable can take.",
    "Formal Language": "Random Distribution \in Probability Theory"
}
```

```json
{
    "Name": "Deviation",
    "Definition": "A measure of the difference between the observed value of a variable and some other value, often that variable's mean.",
    "Formal Language": "Deviation \in Statistics"
}
```

```json
{
    "Name": "Margin of Error",
    "Definition": "A statistic expressing the amount of random sampling error in a survey's results.",
    "Formal Language": "Margin of Error \in Statistics"
}
```

```json
{
    "Name": "Law of Large Numbers",
    "Definition": "A principle of probability and statistics stating that as a sample size grows, its mean will get closer to the average of the whole population.",
    "Formal Language": "Law of Large Numbers \in Probability and Statistics"
}
```

```json
{
    "Name": "Weak Law of Large Numbers",
    "Definition": "A theorem in probability that states that the sample average converges in probability towards the expected value as the sample size grows.",
    "Formal Language": "\(\lim_{n \to \infty} P\left( \left| \frac{1}{n} \sum_{i=1}^{n} X_i - \mathbb{E}[X] \right| > \epsilon \right) = 0\) for any \(\epsilon > 0\), where \(X_i\) are independent and identically distributed random variables."
}
```

```json
{
    "Name": "Mutually Exclusive Events",
    "Definition": "Two events that cannot occur at the same time. If one event happens, the other cannot.",
    "Formal Language": "P(A ∩ B) = 0"
}
```

```json
{
    "Name": "Quantile",
    "Definition": "A value or range that divides a probability distribution or data set into continuous intervals with equal probabilities or frequencies.",
    "Formal Language": "Quantile \in Statistics"
}
```

```json
{
    "Name": "Percentile Rank",
    "Definition": "The percentage of scores in its frequency distribution that are equal to or lower than it.",
    "Formal Language": "Percentile Rank \in Statistics"
}
```

```json
{
    "Name": "Aggregate",
    "Definition": "To combine or sum up multiple items into a single total amount",
    "Formal Language": "Aggregate \in Combination"
}
```

```json
{
    "Name": "Tournament",
    "Definition": "A type of directed graph where each pair of vertices is linked by a single directed edge.",
    "Formal Language": "Tournament \in Graph Theory"
}
```

```json
{
    "Name": "Classification",
    "Definition": "The process of organizing or arranging items into categories or groups based on shared characteristics or criteria.",
    "Formal Language": "Classification \in OrganizingPrinciples"
}
```

```json
{
    "Name": "Harmonic Mean",
    "Definition": "A type of average, calculated as the reciprocal of the arithmetic mean of the reciprocals of a set of numbers",
    "Formal Language": "Harmonic Mean = n / (Σ (1/x_i) for i=1 to n)"
}
```

```json
{
    "Name": "Mean Distance",
    "Definition": "The average of the distances between each data point in a set and a reference point, often the mean of the set.",
    "Formal Language": "Mean Distance = (1/N) * Σ |xi - x̄|, where xi are the data points and x̄ is the mean of the data set"
}
```

```json
{
    "Name": "Random Permutation",
    "Definition": "A random permutation is a rearrangement of a set in a random order.",
    "Formal Language": "Random Permutation \in Randomized Algorithm"
}
```
